intro: Phymatodes scolopendria, commonly known as the Texas starburst lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and has lance-shaped, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a flowering plant in xeric ecosystems.
